etymology.value: The surname is of multiple origins: 1. English: variant of Hally, from the Middle English personal name Halig, from Old English hālig ‘holy’, ‘sacred’. 2. English: topographic name for someone who lived by a patch of holly trees, from Middle English holi(e) ‘holly’ (Old English holen). 3. German: from a pet form of a personal name formed with the element heil ‘hail’, ‘health’, ‘well-being’, ‘salvation’.
